| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | [EvilHack 0.8.3 - monst.c, line 383](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/v0.8.3/src/monst.c#L383) |

**Cerberus**, d, is a [unique](/wiki/Unique "Unique") [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). Both he and [Charon](/wiki/Charon "Charon") are fully implemented and improved from vanilla *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

Cerberus is a [huge](/wiki/Huge "Huge"), three-headed [hell hound](/wiki/Hell_hound "Hell hound")-like [canine](/wiki/Canine "Canine") that guards the [stair](/wiki/Stair "Stair") to [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") in the [Valley of the Dead](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dead "Valley of the Dead"), and must be defeated in order to gain access to the stair and enter the branch. While Cerberus is alive, leaving the Valley via [level teleport](/wiki/Level_teleport "Level teleport") or a cursed [potion of gain level](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_level "Potion of gain level") is not possible. Cerberus is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), [thick-skinned](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned"), can [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible"), has [teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control"), and can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"); he is also accurate, can forcibly move past monsters, and can go [berserk](/wiki/Berserk_\(EvilHack\) "Berserk (EvilHack)") when at low HP.

Cerberus has three bite attacks and the ability to [breathe](/wiki/Breath "Breath") fire, and possesses [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance"), [death resistance](/wiki/Death_resistance "Death resistance"), and a [vulnerability](/wiki/Vulnerability "Vulnerability") to [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold"). He also possesses a special immunity to [beheading](/wiki/Beheading "Beheading") attacks such as those from [Vorpal Blade](/wiki/Vorpal_Blade "Vorpal Blade"): removing any one of his heads will cause him to regrow it instantly. Cerberus is also [sleep resistant](/wiki/Sleep_resistant "Sleep resistant") with one exception: a [magic flute](/wiki/Magic_flute "Magic flute") will lull the beast to sleep for a short amount of time.

Eating Cerberus's [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") grants 2⁄15 (+13%) [additional fire resistance](/wiki/Partial_intrinsic "Partial intrinsic") and has a 1⁄10 chance of conferring teleport control.

## Generation

Cerberus is always generated hostile, and is not a valid form for normal [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

Cerberus is generated [meditating](/wiki/Meditating "Meditating") within the stairwell area of the Valley of the Dead, sitting two squares to the right of the stair.

## Encyclopedia entry

Cerberus, (or Kerberos in Greek), was the three-headed dog  
that guarded the Gates of Hell. He allowed any dead to enter,  
and likewise prevented them all from ever leaving. He was  
bested only twice: once when Orpheus put him to sleep by  
playing bewitching music on his lyre, and the other time when  
Hercules confronted him and took him to the world of the  
living (as his twelfth and last labor).

## References

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Cerberus_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit)*

Cerberus (EvilHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
d Cerberus
Difficulty 30
Attacks Bite 3d6, Bite 3d6, Bite 3d6, Breath 3d6 fire
d Cerberus
Difficulty 30
Attacks

Bite 3d6, Bite 3d6, Bite 3d6, Breath 3d6 fire

Base level 27
Base experience 870
Speed 20
Base AC -7
Base MR 90
Alignment -7 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) Unique
Genocidable No
Weight 1200
Nutritional value 500
Size Huge
Resistances fire,sleep,poison,petrification
Resistances conveyed teleport control (10%), fire (+13%)

Cerberus:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is male.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • appears only in Gehennom.
  • can displace other monsters.
Reference EvilHack 0.8.3 - monst.c, line 383
For other implementations of the monster, see Cerberus.

Cerberus, d, is a unique monster that appears in EvilHack and Hack'EM. Both he and Charon are fully implemented and improved from vanilla NetHack.

Cerberus is a huge, three-headed hell hound-like canine that guards the stair to Gehennom in the Valley of the Dead, and must be defeated in order to gain access to the stair and enter the branch. While Cerberus is alive, leaving the Valley via level teleport or a cursed potion of gain level is not possible. Cerberus is strong, thick-skinned, can see invisible, has teleport control, and can be seen via infravision; he is also accurate, can forcibly move past monsters, and can go berserk when at low HP.

Cerberus has three bite attacks and the ability to breathe fire, and possesses fire resistance, poison resistance, stoning resistance, death resistance, and a vulnerability to cold. He also possesses a special immunity to beheading attacks such as those from Vorpal Blade: removing any one of his heads will cause him to regrow it instantly. Cerberus is also sleep resistant with one exception: a magic flute will lull the beast to sleep for a short amount of time.

Eating Cerberus's corpse or tin grants 2⁄15 (+13%) additional fire resistance and has a 1⁄10 chance of conferring teleport control.

Generation

Cerberus is always generated hostile, and is not a valid form for normal polymorph.

Cerberus is generated meditating within the stairwell area of the Valley of the Dead, sitting two squares to the right of the stair.

Encyclopedia entry

Cerberus, (or Kerberos in Greek), was the three-headed dog
that guarded the Gates of Hell. He allowed any dead to enter,
and likewise prevented them all from ever leaving. He was
bested only twice: once when Orpheus put him to sleep by
playing bewitching music on his lyre, and the other time when
Hercules confronted him and took him to the world of the
living (as his twelfth and last labor).

References

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

'''Cerberus''', {{black|d}}, is a [[unique]] [[monster]] that appears in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. Both he and [[Charon]] are fully implemented and improved from vanilla ''[[NetHack]]''.

Cerberus is a [[huge]], three-headed [[hell hound]]-like [[canine]] that guards the [[stair]] to [[Gehennom]] in the [[Valley of the Dead]], and must be defeated in order to gain access to the stair and enter the branch. While Cerberus is alive, leaving the Valley via [[level teleport]] or a cursed [[potion of gain level]] is not possible. Cerberus is [[strong]], [[thick-skinned]], can [[see invisible]], has [[teleport control]], and can be seen via [[infravision]]; he is also accurate, can forcibly move past monsters, and can go [[Berserk (EvilHack)|berserk]] when at low HP.

Cerberus has three bite attacks and the ability to [[breath]]e fire, and possesses [[fire resistance]], [[poison resistance]], [[stoning resistance]], [[death resistance]], and a [[vulnerability]] to [[cold]]. He also possesses a special immunity to [[beheading]] attacks such as those from [[Vorpal Blade]]: removing any one of his heads will cause him to regrow it instantly. Cerberus is also [[sleep resistant]] with one exception: a [[magic flute]] will lull the beast to sleep for a short amount of time.

Eating Cerberus's [[corpse]] or [[tin]] grants {{frac|2|15}} (+13%) [[Partial intrinsic|additional fire resistance]] and has a {{frac|10}} chance of conferring teleport control.

==Generation==
Cerberus is always generated hostile, and is not a valid form for normal [[polymorph]].

Cerberus is generated [[meditating]] within the stairwell area of the Valley of the Dead, sitting two squares to the right of the stair.

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|
	Cerberus, (or Kerberos in Greek), was the three-headed dog
	that guarded the Gates of Hell.  He allowed any dead to enter,
	and likewise prevented them all from ever leaving.  He was
	bested only twice:  once when Orpheus put him to sleep by

	Hercules confronted him and took him to the world of the
	living (as his twelfth and last labor).
